Transparent oversight, measurable outcomes, and equal application of the law foster confidence among responsible owners and communities alike.

Safeguarding children and communities while honoring the Second Amendment means combining responsible ownership with commonsense safeguards—comprehensive background checks, mandatory safe-storage and basic training, and accessible mental-health resources—implemented with fairness and due process. Collaborative policymaking that listens to gun owners, public-health experts, and impacted families can produce practical, evidence-based rules that reduce tragedies without stripping lawful rights.
